FuncDef: The display license chassis command displays information about an active license file.

ParaDef.Info:
Displays details about a license file.
-

Specifies the ID of a chassis.
-

Examples: RD of Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd.
Item name          Item type      Value      Description
Master board license state: Demo. The license for the current configuration will expire in 62 day(s).
Apply for authentic license before the current license expires.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A license file determines whether some product features are available. To view information about an active license file, run the display license command. The information includes the name, version, valid time, and configuration items of the license file.
The encoding format used to display license information in the current version is UTF-8. To prevent garbled characters when you use a different terminal to log in to the device and Chinese characters are displayed, change the terminal's encoding format to UTF-8.
For example, if you use the PuTTY tool as the terminal, set its encoding format to UTF-8. After the encoding format is set to UTF-8, Chinese information about the license can be correctly displayed.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
